subject: Negotiation
title: The Power of Preparation
description: A quick, practical guide to The Power of Preparation.

hook.text: Abraham Lincoln said: 'Give me six hours to chop a tree and I'll spend four sharpening the axe.'

buildup.text: Most negotiators spend 80% of time at the table and 20% preparing. The best reverse that ratio.

discovery.text: Preparation means researching the other side, rehearsing responses, and planning for every scenario.

twist.text: Prepared negotiators look calm and confident at the table â€” not because of talent but because of homework.

climax.text: For every hour of negotiation, invest at least two hours of preparation.

punchline.text: Preparation is the cheapest leverage and the most powerful.

quiz.question: What ratio of preparation to negotiation do the best negotiators use?
